vidis.util.graphs.graph
Class TreeImpl

java.lang.Object
  vidis.util.graphs.graph.GraphImpl
      vidis.util.graphs.graph.TreeImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Graph, Tree
public class TreeImpl
extends GraphImpl
implements Tree

An implementation of a Tree. This implementation is a free tree and allows zero, one or more child nodes for each node. A free tree is a tree whereby any of the nodes can be a root node. By defauly, the first node added when the tree is empty is the root node.

Directions of Edges in tree are generally ignored. Directionality is basically implied when specifying the root of a Tree, where such operation requires it.

A Tree does not allow cycle paths. So any attempts to create a cycle will thrown a CycleException.

Author:
Jesus M. Salvo Jr.
See Also:

getSubTree

public Tree getSubTree(Vertex subTreeRootVertex)
                throws Exception
Returns a new instance of a Tree that is rooted from the specified node. This method does not alter the Tree itself.

Although a new Tree is returned, the nodes and edges within the new Tree are the same instances as those of the Tree from where it was taken from.

Specified by:
getSubTree in interface Tree
Parameters:
subTreeRootVertex - The root of the subtree that we want to return
Throws:
EmptyTreeException - is the Tree is empty.
Exception

isPath

public boolean isPath(Vertex v1,
                      Vertex v2)
Determines if there is a path from Vertex fromVertex to Vertex toVertex.

Directionality of Edges along the path are ignored. Therefore, isPath( a, b ) is the same as isPath( b, a ).

If either one of the vertices are not in the Tree, the result will be false.

Specified by:
isPath in interface Graph
Specified by:
isPath in interface Tree
Overrides:
isPath in class GraphImpl
Parameters:
v1 - Endpoint of a path
v2 - Endpoint of a path
Returns:
true if there is a path from v1 to v2 or vice-versa. false otherwise.

addNode

public Edge addNode(Vertex parent,
                    Vertex childNode)
             throws Exception
Adds a node to the Tree. The parent node must already be existing in the Tree before the child node can be added. To add the root node, specify null as the parent.

Note that the parent and child relativity is dependent for whatever is the current root node of the Tree. Hence, if childNode later on becomes root via setRoot(), then the parent actually becomes the child of childNode.

This method should be used instead of the superclass' add() methods.

Specified by:
addNode in interface Tree
Throws:
GraphException - if there is already a root or the child node is already existing.
NoSuchVertexException - if the parent is not null and is not existing
Exception

addEdge

public void addEdge(Edge edge)
             throws Exception
Adds an Edge into the Tree. This will only add the Edge if there is currently no path between the two Vertices indicated in the Edge. If there is, a CycleException is thrown.

Specified by:
addEdge in interface Graph
Overrides:
addEdge in class GraphImpl
Parameters:
e - The edge to be added to the Graph.
Throws:
CycleException - if adding the Edge will result in a cycle.
Exception

addEdge

public Edge addEdge(Vertex v1,
                    Vertex v2)
             throws Exception
Adds an Edge into the Tree by creating a new instance of EdgeImpl. This will only add the Edge if there is currently no path between the two Vertices indicated in the Edge. If there is, a CycleException is thrown.

Specified by:
addEdge in interface Graph
Overrides:
addEdge in class GraphImpl
Parameters:
v1 - Endpoint of the Edge to be created / added
v2 - Endpoint of the Edge to be created / added
Returns:
The Edge object created and added to the Graph.
Throws:
CycleException - if creating the Edge will result in a cycle.
Exception

remove

public void remove(Vertex v)
            throws Exception
Removes a leaf node from a Tree. This method will return an IllegalTreeException if you attempt to delete a Vertex that is not a leaf node.

In this method, a leaf node is defined as a Vertex that has zero or one indicent Edge.

Specified by:
remove in interface Graph
Overrides:
remove in class GraphImpl
Parameters:
v - The Vertex which must be a leaf node that is to be removed from the Tree.
Throws:
IllegalTreeException - if removing the Vertex will result in a forest of Trees.
Exception
